page.title: 07RESERVOIRS IN HELMSHORE.
page.content:
The reservoirs are large ditches in the ground which store water. Every month people put fish in and people fish there, if they have a permit.
Dirty water is processed at the filter station and then it goes into the homes of local residents after it has been purified.
One of the biggest reservoirs in our area is called the{Ogden Reservoir}and under the Ogden reservoir is a village called Grane. Many years ago some of the villagers stole gold from the church. Stone by stone the church was removed and rebuilt on another site near the Holden Arms. As a punishment they flooded the village and made it into a reservoir, as it remains today.
